review: What's not to love about Chili's? First of all - check in and get free chips & salsa. They have a great kids menu - great happy hour specials.  It really makes the whole family happy. For me, I've been eating the same food at Chili's since high school - Chicken Fajitas. They are simply the best around.  I've tried a couple of other things- but it always comes back to fajitas.  Especially if you get the 2 for $20 meal - and fajitas are on the list. The Oviedo location is nice - always gets busy - but it's the place to be seen in town!

Best burgers around, the wait is long but that's because there is no place else to eat around here. Prices are reasonable, and the servers are great for the most part. Whoever trains their waiters is doing a great job, give them a raise. The one thing they need to do is expand the building or open another Chillis closer to Lockwood road, hell open anything decent on Lockwood road. This location is so busy I know they lose customers, many times we drove by and left because of the wait. If your in Oviedo, this is pretty much it. Unless you want to go to Millers Ale house that has crappy service, food and long wait times. Added They now have you use a tablet on the table to buy liquor and pay your bill. I am not sure if I like that.  I can see having a problem with it if you are splitting the check or have to have your bill adjusted. I just don't think having a tablet at the table is sanitary. I love my tablet but having a community table is just a germ collecting device. I guess you can still have the pay waitress option since the kiosk only takes credit cards.

It's Chili's.  So you know the food.  It's fine.  At this Chili's however- the hostess greeted us promptly, the manager happened to walk by and also greeted us.  Our waiter John was very nice, very prompt, and knows how much is appropriate to come by a table.  The place was clean- always a bonus in my book!  As far as a Chili's goes- this one is great!
Just like any other Chili's a great place to have some fun with family and friends! Very friendly place!

I mean... it's Chili's. There are some tasty things there, like their beef fajitas. They do them very well. But it's frustrating to not find any real healthy options. Sure, they have their "Lighter Choice" menu, but most of it has some starch or sugar involved. Not a good option.

This is the WORST Chilis I have been to. I was a huge fan of chilis until I went to this location. We had reservation and my wife is vegetarian and I do not eat bacon. She ordered a vegetarian burger and it came with bacon on top. Okay thats a honest mistake. We told the waitress and she came back with a vegetarian burger. That one had a quarter dollar size piece of bacon on it. REALLY!! the second time. More than that, it looked like they just removed the bacon from the first burger and did a lousy job of that. How shitty is that!! Its totally disgusting for a vegetarian to taste bacon.  We called the manager and he did not charge us for the burger. Ofcourse my wife did not eat it.

As a big fan of Chili's for years, I have to say I am not going back to this location any time soon. I've been there twice in the past four months, and both times the service was just utterly disappointing. Once we sat in the dining room and the next time we sat in the bar. On our second visit, the server didn't approach us for several minutes. And then it took almost 10 minutes to get our drinks from the bar. And then our server disappeared for a few minutes more before returning. We ordered fajitas, a chicken dish on the lighter side menu, and two kids' meals among the four of us. We also ordered a guacamole appetizer. The server took several minutes to bring out our chips and salsa, and forgot the guacamole. The chips and salsa are the reason we keep going to Chili's, but this time they were just soggy and greasy and almost rubbery. The server finally brought out the guacamole just two minutes before our meals arrived. When the meals came, all of them were excellent. I was happy my fajitas were sizzling this time, because on my previous visit, they were not. We were all happy with our food, but when we finished eating, we were left to sit and wait and stare at all our dirty dishes for a very long time. We thought the server forgot about us. Finally, he looked over and realized we were waiting on him. He brought the check and didn't remove one plate. Luckily, his co-worker came over and cleared them. It took several more minutes to get my credit card slip to sign. It was just a train wreck. Best way to describe it. Chili's brand is good. The chips and salsa are usually great. Not this time. And bad service to boot left us saying, not again, not anytime soon. Boo.

Had a great dinner here! Our waitress Vanessa, was amazing! So attentive and accommodating to our requests.  The queso was a little thicker than I'm used to, but it's still always SO good!  The margaritas were cold and tasty! My mango-chile chucked was awesome, just a little spicier than I was expecting. For dessert you can't go wrong with the molten chocolate cake.

Gave them another try after saying we would never go back to this location again.   Left wondering why we gave it another chance.   It was not busy &  service was slow. The waitress had a horrible attitude- she dropped the menus in my lap and walked away without apologizing.   The food wasn't bad - however,  there was a dirty plate & two of us never got silverware/napkins.   Our family & friends agreed we will never return.

Chilis is a good value.  Decent food at reasonable cost which is good for a large family.  This Chilis is always busy which is frustrating- always a 20+ minute wait even weeknights; weekends much longer.  Not many other options in Oviedo unfortunately. The chips and salsa are awesome.  Good selection for most folks even those wanting lower calorie.  Service is usually good and attentive.

OMG, what was I thinking? Years ago I tried a Chili's and decided to not come back, why did I change my mind? This place was so bad I created a Yelp account just to review it. The floors were FILTHY. It was disgusting. Half the empty tables were greasy and dirty and still had pieces of food from the last diners on them. I ordered the so-called famous baby back ribs, the wife got some sort of tacos. The ribs- how to describe? They were so small I wondered if they had been cut from a small dog or perhaps cat. They tasted like they were frozen, shoved into a microwave and had BBQ sauce dumped on them. Only after I tasted them was I glad at how small they were. The fries were average at best. The water tasted like chlorine. The tacos were tiny, and the rice served with them wasn't even a Mexican rice. It was a rice pilaf that was buttered. WTF? Nasty. It took a long time to even get this food. I can't imagine why it takes so long to throw together microwave food. Its a shame the Del Taco acrossed the street a ways went out of business, they had far better food and a cleaner dining room. The portions were so small we left feeling like we had ordered appetizers. Clearly, Oviedo has been over-run by idiots given the number of people who think this place has good food. Its a shame they wasted the celery field that used to be here to build this place. This is Mexican food for people who have never had any other Mexican food than Swanson's frozen dinners. How can I give it less stars?

As usual I'll start with the good.  I ordered the 6oz sirlon, trying to watch the calories so I avoided the more choice cuts.  Order broccoli as a side also.  I was pleasantly surprised to have one of the best chain restaurant steaks I've had.  It was tender juicy and cooked perfectly medium.  The broccoli was great as well but steaming broccoli is pretty simple.  The service was great, drinks stayed full and all of the meals came fresh and hot. The only downside was that the place smelled really musty and funky.  not sure if it was just a bad night but the smell was a bit distracting.

Been going to Chilis now for a long long time.  Gotta say I have *never* been disappointed.  I am always impressed with their changes to the menu.  My favorites are their burgers...especially their veggie burger.  You read that right...I love their veggie burger as much as their beefy counterparts.  I never walk out wirhout enjoyi g some happy hour delight on tap.

They need to change the name of this restaurant to "Greasy's". Seriously. The new menu stinks. The classic "Old Timer" is new but definitely not improved. The bun is greasy, the burger is greasy, even the "handmade" pickles are greasy... you get the idea.  Gone are the old baskets with a heaping helping of fries. They've been replaced by the "upscale" square or rectangular plates and a small handful of fries. I complained on Facebook and was rewarded with two $5 gift certificates and a handful of abusive comments from other users. I went back and decided to play it safe with a basket of tostada chips. They can't screw up chips, right? Well... I hate to be repetitive but the chips were (surprise) GREASY! Oily, soggy chips are just yuck. I did not complain since I figured it was a lost cause. So long, Greasy's. You've lost a 20-year customer.

I love this place! Good food from appetizers to steaming fajitas, and decadent desserts to 2 for 1s all day, you can't beat that. I've come here for work, parties and just to hang out with great friends and I've always had a great experience.

Was greeted by rude hostess and was told we would have to wait for the server to arrive before we could be seated. I insisted after a  15 minutes wait. The service went down hill from there.  Our server John finally took our drink orders. We ordered our food as well. Mine was buffalo chicken wings. One the plate was extremely warm but the food wasn't. The blue cheese dip was hot too. The celery was limp from the hot plate. Had to ask for refills of drinks. The food took so long in coming that we were late going to our movie. I asked for a to go box. It was brought after 20 minutes of waiting. I had to get hostess to run my card. my companion was paying in cash and couldn't utilize the machine. I didn't even eat my food and left totally frustrated by the nasty environment and lack of quality of food and service. sad.

Stopped by the Chili's in Oviedo. All I was getting was a margarita, some chips and salsa and an app. It took about 10 minutes before the waiter came over, and another 10 before he brought me four drinks instead of two, apparently it was my fault because he told me next time I should make it clear. I ordered one rocks one frozen and was by myself. He kept four on my bill. He also left me napkins, I picked one up, it had a blood stain on it, the food runner took that away for me.  My girlfriend arrived and asked for chips, he told her they were out and it would be another 15 minutes.  At about 35 minutes he finally brought me chips and salsa. We ate some, decided on what we wanted, ordered that and asked for more chips as the ones he gave us were greasy. They were out of chips again. It was broken to us with a nice 'yeah we're out' as he walked away. Finally got my app, triple dipper, and ordered more drinks, one and one. The boneless wings were burnt dry. He brought me new wings and again twice my drink order.  The manager brought over the right drinks, I told him about the problems, he said he was sorry about all the problems and would take care of it by not making me pay for the drinks I didn't order that were still on my bill. So basically a crappy time at Chili's tonight. Only took an hour and a half for some margaritas, greasy chips, and burnt wings. I liked going to Chili's, getting a drink and some chips and going home. This chilis has gone downhill fast over the past couple months. I don't think they get that there are problems. The last time we were there she sat in the bar with chips waiting on me. I got there with the kids and we moved to a table. The same waiter came to our table in the restaurant to tell her she was getting charged for chips she ate in the bar area now that she left. The apathy of the manager about these things needs to be fixed.

We've eaten here several times over the last 3 years and it's just gotten worse and worse. Tonight we waited 35 min for a table (which is fine, it is a Friday night), when we were finally seated, our table was dirty and had to be cleaned, one of our kids dropped a crayon on the floor and when we leaned down to pick it up, there was a lot of garbage and food under our table. The wait time for our food was just ridiculous, we didn't order anything that would require 45+min to cook (simple burger, tilapia and 2 kids chickens). Our server was also no very attentive. Asked him to refill my drink, he left, came back 10 min later and asked if I wanted a refill... um, yes! I asked 10 min ago! My husband's order was missing things when it finally came out, as well. The manager was nice and reduced our bill but we would have much preferred better service and paid full price. Like I said, their service has never been excellent, but it's gotten so bad the last few times we've been, we've decided not to return. Luckily, there are some new restaurants popping up in the area so we'll have more choices.
We like going here on the weekends with our 4 yr old. Service is good and the food is decent for the price.

Service is always friendly but the kitchen crew needs some training in how to drop food to keep a good flow!  Ordered the pick 3 fresh mex which is a newer item, it came out hot and fresh.  Fried pickles are new and they are really good! Triple dipper app sampler is always a go to food.

Normally my experiences at chilis are usually very good. today it was a little different we had a large party of about 20 and that may have been the reason why. our server was overwhelmed and we had several wrong orders. I wouldnt recommend for large parties as they were not prepared and overall the consensus was the same from others in the party

We got there for dinner.  3 adults and 2 children.  The hostess gave us a notification device and said it will be 30 minutes.  30 minutes pass and no table.  I ask the hostess and she say's we have a party of 25 (in another room) and it will be about 30 minutes more.  The manager was passing by and I asked where is our table.  He said let me check, and he tells us our table is ready.  So I guess if I didn't say anything it would have been another 30 minutes. Now for the food.  After a while our food arrives.  I guess I'm the critical one.  I ordered their $20.00 dinner for two.  My wife had quesadillas and I had the BBQ ribs with smoked potatoes (that's another story). My ribs came out dry, slathered with BBQ sauce on one side in hopes that it would make them tender.  Didn't work.    Back to the potatoes.  They were served in a little fry pan, also dried out. It's a shame because the drinks were good, but the food was pushed out without any concern for quality.  If the restaurant is busy, that is not my problem. This Chili's is off my list.  I will pay anything for quality food and quite frankly this was the farthest from quality, as a caveat,  I will contact Chili's corporate.  All should do the same for bad food or service from any restaurant.

I have been going to this location for years, but lately it's been going down hill.  Case in point.  On 01/18/15 in the evening me and three guest dined at the Winter Springs location.  One of my guests asked for hot tea; a pretty simple request you would think.  What she got was a beer mug filled with warm tea.  When we asked for hot tea in a tea/coffee mug the server looked at me like I had three heads.  She took the warm tea and poured it into a coffee mug and gave it back to us.  When we asked for milk it took for ever to get it.  As you can assume when she did arrived back with milk the tea was now ice cold.  You can't make this stuff up. In addition to that, the food was boarder line warm/cool. Sad, I remembered when I liked going to Chili's.

Ugh, I guess you pretty much know what to expect from Chili's. I never knew it was possible to screw up onion rings, but mine were soggy and bland. I guess they didn't microwave them long enough. My burger was also pretty greasy (yes, I know burgers should be a little greasy, but this was next level) and once again, bland in spite of the bombardment of toppings. My girlfriend had similarly unflattering things to say about her food. Worst of all: there are tablets on all the tables which broadcast advertisements throughout the entire meal. They theoretically serve some purpose (ordering drinks or playing games), but I get the feeling they are seldom used. A meal out should be spent with loved ones and should be one of the handful of times where we're not fixated by some tiny screen. Their inclusion was intrusive and utterly asinine.
Love the food and the trivia games available on table side tablets.... ;) keeps the kids occupied!

One of the worst restaurant experience I ever had poor service, bad management, food that was order came to us all wrong and missing main ingredients, and servers that didn't know what they were doing. All together dinning at this restaurant was a disaster and I will never go to this restaurant again. Stay away from this place. I give this place a double thumbs down. I use to be a Chili's fan but not anymore.  Plus food was served to us on broken plates.

I'm a fan of any Chili's. I always get great service, they are always offering new and fun menu items, and the prices stay reasonable. Kudos to this and all Chili's for being a constantly good place to have a little dinner or a few drinks!

We have been regulars here for 10 years. We loved this place. Especially the chicken fajitas. Over the past year or two, however, we have been very disappointed with the fajitas. The last time we went, I decided I would take it home so I could season it and make it taste good. Sad...... so we haven't been there in a few months. Tonight, we said, "Hey, let's give them another chance. We used to love that place." BAD IDEA. We got drinks, and chips &salsa at the bar, and then we were seated. We sat in our booth for literally 20 MINUTES and no one even acknowledged our existence. Our server must have walked by us 15 times and never said A WORD to us. Meanwhile, tables all around us were getting served. It's like we were invisible. So we left, and I told our "server" why we were leaving on the way out. We went across the street to BJS where we were served right away. I called the Chili's manager, who was very concerned and she has offered me coupons.  Which I will take and give away. Because I am not going back!!

This Chili's is always busy, and the food quality suffers. Came once and the bar area is first come, first serve. Would it be so hard to regulate that area as well? I came for a few drinks with my mother in law to pick up a to-go order and people would swoop in and literally be so rude to others standing waiting. That could all be alleviated if they had a waiting list like the regular dining areas. In my experience the Margaritas are mainly mixer and very little alcohol. This latest time I ordered a to-go order online and the pickup time given was 7:41pm. I arrived two minutes before that and when I got my food it was cold. After spending $50 on dinner, i'd at least expect it to be warm. I looked at the receipt and the kitchen had it made at 6:53p. So my food was sitting for almost a whole hour before we got it. They should try to stick close to the estimated time. The chicken in my fajitas was undercooked and you could tell they rushed it. I love Chilis but I am almost always disappointed by this location.

Haven't been to this Chili's in a while so gave it a try with the family on Sunday about noon.  We ordered Chicken Nachos and the Bacon Ranch Steak Quesadilla to share.  They loved the Quesadilla (I didn't eat any since I don't eat beef) and the Chicken Nachos were 'ok'.   It appears they changed how they make them now and while the originals weren't "amazing", they were pretty decent and grew on me.  If these nachos are their new recipe/way I wouldn't order them again.  Service was good and we were in and out fairly quickly since we beat the church crowd.  Overall a bit disappointed, but won't give up on Chili's yet.
Slow. First they didn't have the beer I ordered, now I am waiting for my food while the kids sit and eat theirs
Drinks...no straws.  Apps...no plates.  Dried up cheese fries.  Waiting and waiting for refills.  Water with lemon...no lemon.  Tanner should not be waiting tables.  Terrible service.

I always loved this place but it has changed and not in a good way. The food has changed we got an appetizer and the plates they gave us were all wet and my daughters booster seat was all dirty and sticky. Not sure if I will come back to this one.
Friendly staff, quick service and food is what you'd expect from any Chilis chain restaurant.

Never had a problem with Chilis until today. I ordered for pick up today and as soon as I got there waited in the curb side for pick up. They usually have someone who comes out and brings your food and receipt. No one. Ok, no problem. When my food came out she opened up the food tray and grabbed the burger bun with her bare hands in front of my face to show me what's inside the burger. If you want to show me what's in the burger please do NOT pick up my food with your bare hands, that's gross. I'm so disgusted.

We used to go to Chilis all the time and stopped going because it was so loud. So with this latest offer of three great items for 10 dollars we decided to give them another try. As soon as we walked in it was still so very loud. I'm not sure what it is about the restaurant and why it's so loud and that parents don't control their screaming kids in beyond belief. But our food and the advertised offer was great. Our waiter was very good for as busy as it was. We enjoyed the food and had more than enough. Great fajitas and the chocolate molten cake is amazing. Next time it's a to go order as it's just too loud to have a conversation inside.

Unfortunately the wait time was ridiculous. It's my own fault, as I should have called ahead. Our waiter was not very attentive and it took forever for the food to arrive. It really appeared to me that the staff and was not sufficient for the crowd that was there.

Let's face it, Chili's is Chili's, am I right? I don't come here having high expectations for food, and believe me, they don't deliver either. The food is inconsistent, nothing comes close to good for you, the broccoli is microwaved, the fried pickles make me sad.....I mean, it's just all over the place. It's not a total loss though. They have drink specials, there is a game console on the table for parents who would like to keep their phones in-hand for a change, and the menu is crazy adaptable to whatever combination of foods you're looking to eat. Maybe *too* adaptable, even. There are so many combos! It's bananas. I will also say this location has excellent service, despite presumed staffing issues preventing keeping tables from staying filled during busy times. They have some situation where you can put yourself in the queue to be seated before you get to the restaurant, which is probably a good idea if you're "planning" to go to Chili's, which we never are. It's a fine weekday place to take the family for dinner when no one has it in them to cook dinner. It's a bit sad for the vegetarians/vegans, but not impossible to make do.

Stopped in for dinner while out shopping. Service is always quick, food comes out hot and always as ordered. Pleasant wait staff, always there when you need them but not hovering. A regular stop for us.

Today my family spent our very last dollar and lunch at this Chili's location.   Not only was every meal so bad and prepared poorly but it also made our children sick after the meal.     The staff is also clueless about how to serve food and wait on customers. One occasion the waitress was sweeping under every chair in our section next to us and DRAGGING each chair across the floor so loudly we could  not even hear ourselves talk.  We asked her to stop and she had a look of dismay on her face.    We are a family of 4 and know that Chili's is not a fine dinning experience but their food, staff and managers need to go back to training school and figure out why their reviews are so bad at this location.   Sorry Chili's we can't give you our business again.
The place was packed. The server wasn't happy, not too friendly. Food was served pretty fast. It was good however not to die for.

Ate there yesterday - 4 Apr 2017.  Loud and crowded as always.  But that's a good thing for the restaurant, right?  Means they're doing something right, correct? Getting food was slow, as usual.  We have waited an hour to get a 4-person meal before.  This time it was over 30 minutes (after ordering) get soup, salad, mac, and queso for 4 people.  The table next to us was seated, ate, paid, and left before we were even served. The food had obviously been overlooked under a heat lamp.  The cold salad came out on hot plates and the cheese was melting.  Supposed to be a simple, cold, house salad. The server was polite though not warm or friendly.  Just busy. And then we got hit with the $2 Entertainment Charge.  I asked what this was and they said it was for playing with the Ziosk (tablet).  I said I never touched it.  They asked if my child did.  I said probably and that they could charge him if they wanted to.  He gets about a dollar a week for allowance when he's behaving.  The waitress wasn't happy.  I asked her when Chili's received my consent to charge me for playing a game.  She said my child must've given consent ("clicked the OK button").  I asked her if children are allowed to enter into contractual agreements.  She had the charge removed. What a scam.
Same quality but now no free chips. I guess all the chilis has stop this. Epic fail.                   .
Good food and good service.  Would have left 5 star review, but they just raised their prices and it's getting a little expensive.

Had the new chicken crispers on waffles.  The chicken was overcooked, super tough/chewy and the waffles were cold? Not sure if they were susposed to be or not. I would have preferred them hot.  The Texas cheese fries were awesome!! And I had a taste of dessert which was delightful and tastey.  The service in the bar area was great, very attentive.  I just  wish to take away anything empty on those tiny tables!
Chili's is a classic been going there for burgers and fajitas for years. Different locations between Florida and Texas. One of our favorites.

First off I want to say is I love Chili's. The food, drinks and atmosphere is amazing. Everything always tastes great and the drinks are delicious. However, I ordered from Chili's take out one day and not only got the complete wrong order which was someone else's order, when I came back inside to pick up what was my actual order (was waiting on the big mouth bites that I didn't get at first, they also took the extra egg rolls that they accidentally gave us which is not ethically allowed to bring back in the kitchen seeing as it went outside of the doors) I saw someone in the back pick up the closest thing to them that were unfinished and very cold burger bites instead of freshly cooking what we had originally had ordered. We would have gladly waited the extra time for it to be remade. I am just very disappointed at my experience with Chili's take out service.
We come here often. It can be busy but the food is always good and the staff is friendly and attentive. Shout out to our server Austin who was fantastic.
Not the best experience. The food took longer than expected. The queso dip didnt sit well with myself or my guest. The hamburger needed more seasoning.
